results.title: The Cold dawn
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Air Ministry and John Elliot
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “War in the Air”.
Part 12 of a 15-part series telling the story of air power and its impact on the world specially compiled by the BBC in 1954-55, 90% of which comes from actual combat material. The remainder consists of extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and shot by BBC Production Unit with the co-operation and advice of the services. This part centres on the Winter and Spring of 1944-45 when the ring around Germany begins to tighten.

results.title: The Coffee break machine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Muppet Coffee Break”.
As the technologically advanced ‘Coffee Break Machine’ explains the intricacies of its functions, the Cookie Monster proceeds to devour it with explosive results. Stars an early model of the Muppet Show’s ‘Cookie Monster’.

results.title: The Coen brothers
results.brief_description: This low-key documentary on filmmaking brothers Ethan and Joel Coen, was made during the filming of “O Brother where art thou?” The media shy brothers are reputed for playing with established film genres, and a disciplined approach that has enabled them to gain autonomy from studio executives and artistic freedom to create idiosyncratic, original work. Their oeuvre includes “Fargo”, “Raising Arizona”, “The Big Lebowski”, “The Hudsucker proxy”, “Miller’s crossing” and “Barton Fink”. The Coens’ meticulous planning of production allows them to consistently deliver films on budget that often achieve cult status. As a film student Joel was working on others’ low budget films, before undertaking the writing of original scripts with his philosophy graduate brother, Ethan. Their first film, “Blood simple” was an instantaneous alternative classic. The brothers have an unusual style in that they both contribute to filmmaking tasks and share screenwriting recognition, but Joel is credited with directing and Ethan with producing. Features interviews with the Coens, George Clooney, Peter Stormare, Holly Hunter, Jeff Bridges, John Turturro, former school teachers, and a range of close friends who attempt to explain the Coens’ relaxed and symbiotic working relationship. Although they have made the occasional dud, the Coens are consistent in their output and appear to have an untapped well of ideas at their disposal.

results.title: The Codling moth
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Stephen Ackroyd and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the life cycle of the Codling Moth: the laying and hatching of the eggs; the larva burrowing to the centre of an apple and feeding; larva leaving the infected fruit for hibernation; spinning of the cocoon; changes taking place in the pupal stage; emergence of the adult moth. A diagrammatic section summarises the main stages of the life cycle. No narration, only music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Film Unit, Stephen Ackroyd and J.V. Durden

results.title: The Coconut tree
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. The coconut is the islands’ only export and the coconut palm is also esential for the people’s immediate livelihood. Shows the products derived from this source by the islanders. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Coconut
results.creator_credit: Birch Hill Film Productions, Dudley Birch and Douglas Hill
results.brief_description: A brief survey of the culture and agriculture of Sri Lanka and study of the cultivation of the coconut as well as the main uses of copra and its by-products.

results.title: The Cocoanuts
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Monta Bell, James R. Cowan, Walter Wanger, Joseph Santley and Robert Florey
results.brief_description: Another hilarious film starring Groucho, Harpo, Zeppo and Chico Marx, ‘Cocoanuts’ is one of the early talkie films and the Marx Brother’s first film. Set in Miami, Groucho Marx plays Hotel Manager, Mr Hammer, struggling to keep his establishment from going under. Hammer’s only paying guest is Mrs Potter (Margaret Dumont), whose daughter Polly (Mary Eaton) is in love with aspiring architect, Bob (Oscar Shaw). Mrs Potter would prefer that Polly marry the respectable Harvey Yates (Cyril Ring); little does she know that he is a jewel thief. Throughout this basic story the four Marx brothers create havoc in their usual slapstick manner, with hilarious results.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Pictures, Monta Bell, James R. Cowan, Walter Wanger, Joseph Santley and Robert Florey

results.title: The Coca-Cola Kid
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Le Clezio, David Roe and Dusan Makavejev
results.brief_description: Droll, sometimes wacky comedy in which an American representative from the multi-national soft-drink company of the title heads for Australia to establish his company’s product as the beverage of choice and along the way ends up finding the road to success filled with obstacles that include a passionate romance. Stars Greta Scacchi and Eric Roberts. Cinematography by Dean Semler. Based on the Frank Moorhouse novel. Rated: M

results.title: The Coasts of Clyde
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Stewart McAllister and James Ritchie
results.brief_description: A tour of the Firth of Clyde by Bernard Braden, Canadian film and stage actor. Visits to Largs and Dunoon, Rothesay and Loch Lomond; scientists working at a Fishing Research Station, holiday-makers on steamer trips up and down the firth; seals playing around the Kyles of Bute. Finally Braden visits Arran, the island where his grandparents left to sail for the new world.

results.title: The Coastguard
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Michael Barden and Simon Campbell-Jones
results.brief_description: The film was made for the 150th anniversary of the founding of H.M. Coastguard. It shows the work carried out by the Coastguard Service in saving life at sea and on the coast, both directly and through their co-ordination with R.A.F. Navy, Post Office and R.N.L.I.
